channel.title: No-ip
channel.description: Well okay I got my router hooked up to my main computer that hosts my server. Now I got a wired cable connected to my other computer so I can get on the internet. My question is,, how do I run another server on my other computer? The problem I'm getting is I made a new Ip address, but when I logged onto the server, it was the server I host. I just made a new no-ip account, but I don't know if that will work...

item.title: No-ip
item.dc:creator: @bhpkyeah satesql
item.description:
@bhpkyeah wrote:

Wouldn’t matter about that. you can change the port, its still gonna be the same… If its the same Ip the client just thinks your connecting to the server, and if you change the port you just get an error. Just don’t know how to intrigate hamachi ip into the client.

Read full topic

@vrac_defiled wrote:

oh yeah! You can do that, only you cant have 2 same ports in the same time

Read full topic

item.title: No-ip
item.dc:creator: @jarnohhh jarnohhh
item.description:
@jarnohhh wrote:

You can if you have another port on your other server. Just change the port iin the file: “Server” to your new port, and forward your new port, and than you have 2 servers

Better explain:

  1. Go to your other source, and go in the file "Server
  2. Search for 43594 and change it to 5555 (or if you use another port like 6666 or something)
  3. Save and compile
  4. Forward your new port.
  5. Log in with the same ip of your other server but with the new port.
  6. You can make 2 ips on no-ip, so u can use the one for ur other server and the other for ur other one, but u can always use all ips, just change the ports for the servers.

-Shadow aka Legendary aka Jarnohh

Read full topic
